intro: Alloispermum michoacanum var. michoacanum, commonly known as the Michoacan stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, where it forms dense mats or clusters. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the spring or early summer. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and collections.
